from StringIO import StringIO%%00010import matplotlib.pyplot as plt%%00010from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve, auc%%00010%%00010# Identify class labels and model probabilities%%00010labels = input_table['Target_Column']%%00010models = input_table._get_numeric_data()%%00010%%00010# Compute ROC curve and ROC area for each model%%00010fpr = dict()%%00010tpr = dict()%%00010roc_auc = dict()%%00010%%00010for i in range(len(models.columns)):%%00010 fpr[i], tpr[i], _ = roc_curve(labels, models.iloc[:,i], pos_label="Y")%%00010 roc_auc[i] = auc(fpr[i], tpr[i])%%00010%%00010# Plot of a ROC curve for a specific class%%00010plt.figure()%%00010for i in range(len(models.columns)):%%00010 model_label = str(models.columns[i]) + ' ({1:0.2f})' ''.format(i, roc_auc[i])%%00010 plt.plot(fpr[i], tpr[i], label= model_label)%%00010%%00010plt.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], 'k--')%%00010plt.xlim([0.0, 1.0])%%00010plt.ylim([0.0, 1.05])%%00010plt.xlabel('False Positive Rate')%%00010plt.ylabel('True Positive Rate')%%00010plt.title('ROC Curves')%%00010plt.legend(loc="lower right")%%00010%%00010# Save image as svg string to output%%00010buffer = StringIO()%%00010plt.savefig(buffer, format='svg')%%00010output_image = buffer.getvalue()
